bowling

Interface IGame

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Bowling, Game

    public interface IGame
    Models a bowling-style game

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Player addPlayer(java.lang.String name)
      Adds a player to the game
      Player getActivePlayer()
      Returns the current player
      int getActivePlayerCount()
      Returns the actual number of active players
      int getMaxPlayerCount()
      Returns the maximum number of active players
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of this game mode
      int getPinCount()
      Returns the number of pins in this game mode
      int getPinsLeft()
      Returns the number of pins currently standing
      Player getPlayer(int id)
      Returns the player with the given ID, or null if there is no such player
      int getRound()
      Returns the current round
      int getRoundCount()
      Returns the maximum number of rounds
      int[] getScore(Player player)
      Returns the score for a given player.
      int getThrow()
      Returns the current throw number
      Player getWinner()
      Returns the player who has won the game.
      boolean hasFinished()
      Indicates if the game has been finished
      boolean hasStarted()
      Indicates if the game has been started
      boolean startGame()
      Starts the game
      boolean throwBall(int count)
      Throws a ball

        Returns:
        the player object, or null if an error occurred

        Returns the number of pins currently standing
        Returns:
        the number of pins still standing

      • getPlayer

        Player getPlayer(int id)
        Returns the player with the given ID, or null if there is no such player
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the player we are looking for
        Returns:
        the player with ID id or null if there is not such player

      • getRound

        int getRound()
        Returns the current round
        Returns:
        the round, starting with 1

      • getRoundCount

        int getRoundCount()
        Returns the maximum number of rounds
        Returns:
        the maximum number of rounds

      • getScore

        int[] getScore(Player player)
        Returns the score for a given player. The format depends on the game mode.
        Parameters:
        player - the given player
        Returns:
        the score of the selected player

      • getThrow

        int getThrow()
        Returns the current throw number
        Returns:
        the throw number, starting with 1

      • getWinner

        Player getWinner()
        Returns the player who has won the game.
        Returns:
        player who won, or null if an error occurred

      • hasFinished

        boolean hasFinished()
        Indicates if the game has been finished
        Returns:
        true if the game is complete

      • hasStarted

        boolean hasStarted()
        Indicates if the game has been started
        Returns:
        true if the game is running

      • startGame

        boolean startGame()
        Starts the game
        Returns:
        true if the game was started, false if any error occurred, e.g., not enough players

      • throwBall

        boolean throwBall(int count)
        Throws a ball
        Parameters:
        count - number of pins this ball hits
        Returns:
        true if the throw was valid, false if any error occurred, e.g., game not started, invalid count, ...
